Ingredients: 

• 5 ripe tomatoes 
• 1 small onion 
• 2-3 cloves garlic 
• 2-3 jalapeño or serrano chilies (adjust to your spice preference) 
• 1/4 cup fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves 
• Juice of 1-2 limes (adjust to taste) 
• Salt, to taste 

Optional Additions: 

• 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder 
• 1/2 teaspoon sugar (if you prefer a touch of sweetness) 

Procedure: 

1. Start by roasting the tomatoes and chilies. You can do this by placing them on a hot skillet or griddle. Turn them occasionally until the skin blisters and begins to char. Alternatively, you can broil them in the oven for a few minutes. This step adds a smoky flavor to the salsa. 

2. While the tomatoes and chilies are roasting, peel and roughly chop the onion and garlic. Also, chop the fresh cilantro. 

3. Once the tomatoes and chilies are roasted, let them cool slightly. Then, remove the skin from the tomatoes and cut off the tops of the chilies. 

4. In a blender or food processor, combine the roasted tomatoes, chilies, onion, garlic, and cilantro. If you like a milder salsa, you can remove the seeds from the chilies. 

5. Add the lime juice to the blender, along with salt to taste. You can start with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and adjust from there. 

6. If you'd like to add a touch of sweetness and some depth of flavor, you can also add the optional cumin and sugar at this stage. 

7. Blend the mixture until it reaches your desired consistency. Some people like a chunky salsa, while others prefer it smooth. You can adjust by pulsing the blender accordingly. 

8. Taste the salsa and adjust the seasoning, lime juice, or spiciness as needed. 

9. Transfer the salsa to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. 


This resting time allows the flavors to meld together. Serve the homemade salsa with tortilla chips, tacos, burritos, or any of your favorite Mexican dishes. Enjoy your freshly made salsa!
